content.en: Cardiac imaging advancements: Scientists have been exploring various algorithms to improve the estimation of heart surface potential distributions and noninvasive electrocardiographic imaging. These algorithms, such as automatic adaptive refinement and local regularization procedures, the generalized minimal residual method, and epicardial potential and myocardial activation-based inverse simulations, are being used to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of cardiac imaging techniques. Additionally, researchers are investigating the implications of using different potential formulations, spatiotemporal regularization approaches, and hybrid regularization frameworks to solve electrocardiographic inverse problems.
content.da: Fremskridt inden for hjertediagnostik: Forskere har udforsket forskellige algoritmer for at forbedre estimeringen af hjertets overfladespændingsfordeling og ikke-invasiv elektrokardiografisk billeddannelse. Disse algoritmer, såsom automatisk adaptiv forfining og lokale regulariseringsprocedurer, den generaliserede minimale resterende metode, samt inverse simuleringer baseret på epikardiale potentialer og myokardiel aktivering, bliver anvendt for at øge nøjagtigheden og effektiviteten af hjertediagnostiske teknikker. Derudover undersøger forskere konsekvenserne af at bruge forskellige potentialformuleringer, spatiotemporale regulariseringsmetoder og hybride regulariseringsrammer til at løse elektrokardiografiske inverse problemer.
